title: Missing definition of CAFFE2_MODULE in rocksdb module
body_html:
• PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
  • OS: Windows 10 & CentOS 7
  • Python version: 3.6
  • VS version (if compiling from source): 2017
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 6.3.1
  • CMake version: 3.11

Visual Studio 2017 is complaining about CAFFE2_MODULE in modules/rocksdb/rocksdb.cc
Seems that we're missing #include "caffe2/core/module.h".

GCC also failed to compile:

../modules/rocksdb/rocksdb.cc:114:14: error: expected constructor, destructor, or type conversion before ‘(’ token
 CAFFE2_MODULE(caffe2_rocksdb, "RocksDB implementation for caffe2::DB.");

body:
- PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
- OS: Windows 10 & CentOS 7
- Python version: 3.6
- VS version (if compiling from source): 2017
- GCC version (if compiling from source): 6.3.1
- CMake version: 3.11

Visual Studio 2017 is complaining about `CAFFE2_MODULE` in `modules/rocksdb/rocksdb.cc`
Seems that we're missing `#include "caffe2/core/module.h"`.

GCC also failed to compile:
```
../modules/rocksdb/rocksdb.cc:114:14: error: expected constructor, destructor, or type conversion before ‘(’ token
 CAFFE2_MODULE(caffe2_rocksdb, "RocksDB implementation for caffe2::DB.");
```
